title: California Firm Recalls Beef Products Due to Misbranding and Undeclared Allergen
summary: WASHINGTON, May 23, 2014 Chaparros Mexican Foods Inc., a Vista, Calif., establishment is recalling approximately 568,503 pounds of beef products due to misbranding and an undeclared allergen, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The products were formulated with...
impacted_products: 100 lb. cases containing 20lb. bags, five per case, diced beef for broiling labeled “Alberto’s Meat Shop”
60 lb. cases containing beef trim labeled “Alberto’s Meat Shop”
100 lb. cases containing 20lb. bags, five per case, beef chorizo labeled “Alberto’s Meat Shop”
